topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 1.1: Applying the Rabbit MQ Random Password Patch

body.section:
After executing this patch, OpenStack services will use a string of random characters as the RabbitMQ password. By default the services will use guest as the password. You should have downloaded the patch files in the Prerequisites.
The password is located in the <cloud-name>/clouds/v0/001/stage/ansible/group_vars/<tier-name> file at:FND_RMQ: vars: rmq_service_password:random rmq_service_user: guest
The random password can be found in the rmq_service_password field.
Notes:
The Ceilometer service will be set to always use the password metering_secret.
The Nova and Neutron services will be set to use the password metada_shared_secret.
The services will communicate with RabbitMQ using the newly defined password. Note: You need the Ubuntu patch utility installed on the HLM host. If you do not have the utility installed, use the following command:apt-get install patch
To apply the patch:
Copy the random-password.tar.gz to the ~/patch_cghelion1.1 directory. cp random-password.tar.gz ~/patch_cghelion1.1
Use the following command to extract the random-password.tar.gz: tar -zxvf random-password.tar.gz

section.title: Apply the patch to the Configuration Processor

ol.li: Change to the following directory: cd ~/kenobi-configuration-processor

Execute the following command to perform a dry-run of the patch to verify: patch -p1 --dry-run < ~/patch_cghelion1.1/random-password-cp.patch
The output appears similar to the following:checking file Data/Site/services/ceilometer/api.json checking file Data/Site/services/cinder/cinder.json checking file Data/Site/services/cinder/scheduler.json checking file Data/Site/services/glance/api.json checking file Data/Site/services/heat/api.json checking file Data/Site/services/icinga/service.json checking file Data/Site/services/keystone.json checking file Data/Site/services/logstash.json checking file Data/Site/services/neutron/api.json checking file Data/Site/services/nova/api.json checking file Data/Site/services/rabbitmq.json

Execute the following command to apply the patch:patch -p1 < ~/patch_cghelion1.1/random-password-cp.patch
The output appears similar to the following:patching file Data/Site/services/ceilometer/api.json patching file Data/Site/services/cinder/cinder.json patching file Data/Site/services/cinder/scheduler.json patching file Data/Site/services/glance/api.json patching file Data/Site/services/heat/api.json patching file Data/Site/services/icinga/service.json patching file Data/Site/services/keystone.json patching file Data/Site/services/logstash.json patching file Data/Site/services/neutron/api.json patching file Data/Site/services/nova/api.json patching file Data/Site/services/rabbitmq.json

section.title: Apply the patch to the Node Configuration

ol.li: Change to the following directory: cd ~/kenobi-node-configuration

Execute the following command to perform a dry-run of the patch to verify: patch -p1 --dry-run < ~/patch_cghelion1.1/random-password-nc.patch
The output appears similar to the following:checking file ansible-playbooks/roles/FND-RMQ/tasks/deploy.yml checking file ansible-playbooks/roles/FND-RMQ/tasks/updateusrpass.yml

Execute the following command to apply the patch: patch -p1 < ~/patch_cghelion1.1/random-password-nc.patch
The output appears similar to the following:patching file ansible-playbooks/roles/FND-RMQ/tasks/deploy.yml patching file ansible-playbooks/roles/FND-RMQ/tasks/updateusrpass.yml

section.title: Synchronize the Patch Files to the Environment

ol.li: Execute the following command to synch the patch file:./hlm_prepare-env.sh

body.p: Return to the KVM + ESX installation.
